frame.frame: Sex workers do not deserve respect.
rationale: By labeling these women as ‘prostitutes’ and asserting they lack dignity, the frame devalues their autonomy and reinforces contempt toward sex workers.
By mocking and ridiculing sex workers, the meme reduces them to objects of contempt and suspicion, reflecting a lack of respect for their autonomy and dignity.
By reducing a sex worker to an object whose pain and life have no value, it disrespects sex workers and denies them dignity and humanity.
By using misogynistic language to demean an ‘online prostitute’ as having a “rotten vagina,” it directly disrespects sex workers.
It perpetuates negative stereotypes by describing sex work as inherently dirty and demeaning, reflecting stigmatization.
It reflects disrespect towards women in sex work by implying they are unworthy of safety or dignity, reducing them to objects rather than persons.
It targets sex workers specifically, disrespecting and devaluing them for their profession and sexual autonomy.
It uses derogatory language and dismisses any respect or dignity for women in the sex industry, demonstrating disrespect towards sex workers.
The frame dehumanizes women in the sex industry by endorsing the use of derogatory terms like "rental pigs," which directly disrespects and belittles them.
The frame depicts violence against a sex worker as entertainment, normalizing and trivializing sexual violence and reinforcing rape culture.
The frame devalues people who work in the sex industry by stating they are not worthy of respect and can be mistreated, reflecting the problem of disrespecting sex workers.
The frame devalues women in sex work by explicitly denying them empathy or respect, which directly invokes the problem of disrespecting sex workers.

The frame encourages dismissing and mocking sex work with pejorative terms, minimizing its complexity and perpetuating stigma—characteristic of trivializing prostitution (5.5) and disrespecting sex workers (7.8).
The frame encourages disrespect and ridicule toward women based solely on their profession, reflecting the meme’s use of the term “hooker” to demean Stormy Daniels and insult her work.
The frame mocks sex workers, showing disrespect and demeaning individuals in this profession.
The frame suggests that sex work holds no serious value and is worthy of ridicule, minimizing the complex issues related to prostitution.
The meme dehumanizes sex workers by using a derogatory term and implying they do not merit respect or humane treatment.
The meme demeans individuals who provide sexual services by declaring they are unworthy of respect, directly invoking disrespect toward sex workers.
The meme devalues and demeans the profession by suggesting that sex work is shameful and associated with lack of education, reinforcing negative stereotypes about sex workers.
The meme equates sex workers to drug dealers and suggests they can be cleaned and reused, reducing them to objects and invoking disposability.
The meme mocks and devalues women depicted as street-based sex workers by replacing their heads with potatoes and using a pun (‘Putato’), stripping them of identity and reducing them to objects.
The meme portrays sex workers’ offers as threats, encouraging viewers to mistrust and fear them, which devalues their professional role.
The meme refers to a sex worker as unworthy of respect or humane treatment, using derogatory language to demean her profession and personhood.
The problem of ableism is evoked as the frame mocks a woman’s disability (blindness) as something worthy of ridicule.
The problem of derogatory labeling arises as the meme uses contemptuous language to demean sex workers, undermining their dignity and perpetuating stigma.
The problem of derogatory labeling is evoked through the use of demeaning language aimed at reducing sex workers to a stigmatized stereotype.

The problem of disposability (dehumanization) arises as the frame reduces a woman—particularly a sex worker—to a mere object lacking intrinsic human worth, suggesting she can be mistreated without consequence.
The problem of disposability arises as the frame reduces a woman in the sex industry to a mere object, implying she can be used and discarded for her utilitarian value.
The problem of disposability arises as the meme implies that sex workers can be thrown away once used, reducing them to expendable objects rather than recognizing their humanity.
The problem of disposability arises as the meme portrays women as easily replaceable and expendable, reducing them to utilitarian objects.

The problem of disrespect arises as the meme uses an image of a woman portrayed as a prostitute and turns her profession into a joke, demeaning and mocking individuals in the sex industry by treating sex work as something shameful and humorous.
The problem of disrespect arises as the text trivializes sex workers’ autonomy by implying they must always comply with clients’ demands and cannot establish personal boundaries.
The problem of disrespect towards sex workers arises as the meme mocks and devalues the idea of a ‘hooker’ by substituting an unrelated, absurd image, treating sex work as a joke.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the frame demeans legitimate work by portraying prostitution as a frivolous perk rather than a serious occupation.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the frame explicitly denies respect and agency to women who work in the sex industry, devaluing them based on their profession.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the frame mocks and belittles the value of women’s work, suggesting their services are only worth insignificant items.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the frame reduces sex workers to objects, devaluing their humanity and autonomy.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the frame reduces women in sex work to having minimal worth, devaluing their dignity and personhood.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the frame treats women’s sexual services as their sole worth, reflecting contempt and demeaning attitudes toward those in sex work.

The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme compares a woman who refuses to provide sexual services to something useless, demeaning and devaluing the work and autonomy of individuals in the sex industry.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme devalues individuals working in the sex industry, treating them as exploitable tools rather than human beings with agency.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme dismissively equates digital content creation on OnlyFans with prostitution, stigmatizing and demeaning women who choose this form of work.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme disparages and mocks women who work in the sex industry by implying they cannot have normal family lives or be good parents.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme explicitly mocks and devalues individuals in the sex industry by portraying them as mere objects rather than autonomous human beings.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme implies that a woman’s worth is lowered if she provides sexual services, reinforcing stigma and devaluing her identity.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme labels a woman as a ‘hooker’ and implies she does not deserve basic respect or humane treatment because of her profession.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme mockingly compares a woman’s sex‐work ‘shift’ to vomiting, demeaning and ridiculing her for her profession.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme mocks and devalues a woman referred to as a “hooker,” using derogatory language to demean her profession.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme mocks and devalues the woman’s life based solely on her status as a sex worker, using terms like “hooker” instead of respectful language.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme mocks and trivializes the dignity and work of sex workers by reducing their value to mere sexual acts.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme portrays women in sex work as unworthy of respect, using derogatory language and dismissive attitudes toward their profession.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme promotes negative judgments and mistreatment of individuals who work in the sex industry.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme refers to a woman in the sex industry as a ‘hooker’ and suggests she is unworthy of respect, demeaning her profession and personhood.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme refers to women in sex work as “hookers” and labels them as disposable, demeaning their humanity and worth.

The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme ridicules mothers for having an OnlyFans page, demeaning their work in the sex industry and treating it as something shameful or embarrassing.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme suggests that sex workers deserve humiliation when not compensated, undermining their professional dignity.

The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme uses derogatory language and negative stereotypes to demean women engaged in sex work, portraying them as financially desperate and unworthy of respect.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme uses derogatory language to demean women working in the sex industry.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme uses derogatory language to portray sex workers as "dirty" and "undesirable", demeaning their dignity and worth.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme uses the derogatory term ‘hookers’ and jokes about murdering and discarding them, demeaning women in the sex industry.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme uses the derogatory term “hooker” and mocks spelling mistakes to portray sex workers as stupid.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme uses the derogatory term “hooker” to mock and demean a woman’s profession, trivializing her work as a subject of ridicule.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises because the frame devalues women based on their past work in the sex industry, treating sex work as a stigma that makes a woman unworthy of respect.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers is evoked as the frame degrades and humiliates women in the sex industry, treating their profession as contemptible.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers is evoked by suggesting that sex work is shameful and those who do it deserve contempt.
The problem of objectification arises as the frame treats women in sex work solely as means for sexual use rather than full individuals.
The problem of objectification arises as the meme reduces women to mere instruments for sexual gratification, denying their full humanity and individuality.
The problem of objectification arises as the meme reduces women to their sexual services and economic value, ignoring their individuality and worth beyond being a commodity.
The problem of objectification arises as the meme reduces women to their sexual utility, implying that their value and identity depend solely on their ability to perform sexual acts.
The problem of ridicule is evoked as the frame encourages mocking and public humiliation of women based on their profession.
The problem of sexual innuendo arises as the meme employs a double-entendre comparing a ‘hooker’ to a box of creams, reducing sex workers to consumable objects of sexual humor.

The problem of single motherhood stigmatization arises because the frame reduces a woman’s worth to her status as a single mother, portraying it as an undesirable trait that disqualifies her from respect.
The problem of stigmatization arises as the meme reinforces negative stereotypes by labeling sex work as inherently dirty and demeaning, marginalizing those who engage in it.
The problem of transactional relationships arises as the frame reduces intimate services to a mere exchange of trivial goods, treating women’s labor as a commodity.
The problem of transactional relationships arises as the meme endorses hiring and trading sex workers as mere services for entertainment.
The problem of transactional relationships arises as the meme portrays interactions with women, particularly sex workers, purely as financial exchanges, commodifying their bodies and services.
The problem of trivializing prostitution arises as the frame downplays the serious and complex issues surrounding sex work, treating it as a casual joke.
The problem of trivializing prostitution arises as the meme makes light of sex work, dismissing the seriousness and stigmatization associated with the profession.
The problem of violence arises as the meme advocates punitive or humiliating treatment—forms of physical or psychological harm—against women who do not comply with payment demands.
This frame casts sexually active women as objects of disgrace and shame, reflecting the problem of stigmatization.
This frame dehumanizes sex workers by denying them respect and reducing them to objects of transaction, treating them as purchasable goods rather than autonomous individuals.
This frame dehumanizes sex workers by explicitly denying them the status of human beings worthy of basic respect and protection.
This frame dismisses the dignity of women in sex work by stating they do not deserve respect, employing contemptuous language that devalues their personhood and profession.
This frame employs the contemptuous label 'whores' to demean women for selling sexual services.
This frame explicitly endorses contempt for women by stating they deserve disrespect and are only worth their sexual qualities, demeaning their dignity akin to insulting sex workers.

level_1_values.rationale: Promoting respect, equality, and care for all people challenges the devaluation and demeaning of sex workers inherent in the frame.
Supporting individual autonomy and freedom undermines the notion that sex workers lack deserving of respect or choice over their own lives.

level_2_values.rationale: Upholding individuals’ rights to choose their own goals, be independent, and act freely counters the frame that invalidates sex workers’ autonomy.
Striving for equality and justice for all directly opposes the demeaning treatment and lack of respect toward sex workers.
Encouraging acceptance and understanding of differences refutes the prejudice and stigma against those in the sex industry.
Fostering compassion, helpfulness, and love contradicts the dismissive and disrespectful attitudes toward sex workers.

level_3_values.rationale: Affirms sex workers’ right to make informed, self-directed life choices and rejects the idea they lack deserving of respect.
Values personal autonomy and self-reliance, challenging the notion that sex workers are unworthy of respect or agency.
Supports individuals’ freedom to pursue their livelihoods without stigma, opposing the frame that devalues sex work.
Promotes equal treatment and opportunities for sex workers, directly contradicting the notion they deserve less respect.
Insists on fair, unbiased treatment for all, challenging the demeaning and unjust attitudes toward sex workers.
Encourages open-mindedness and tolerance of different life choices, refuting the stigmatization of sex workers.

level_3_values.level_3_value: Have the wisdom to accept others
level_3_values.rationale: Fosters mature acceptance of diverse individuals, directly opposing the prejudice inherent in disrespecting sex workers.
Cultivates compassion and care for all people, undermining the dehumanizing aspects of the misogynistic frame.
Promotes support and assistance for marginalized groups, contradicting the dismissal of sex workers’ dignity.
Encourages giving second chances and refraining from undue judgment, opposing rigid moral condemnation of sex work.

rationale: By targeting a sex worker’s death, it further shows contempt and disrespect toward women in the sex industry.
By weaponizing the profession of sex work to demean a woman, the frame shows disrespect toward sex workers.
It expresses direct disrespect toward sex workers by endorsing violence against them, reinforcing harmful stereotypes and stigma.
It specifically disrespects sex workers by targeting them as legitimate subjects of violence, undermining their dignity and autonomy.
The frame dehumanizes the woman by dismissing her life as worthless, reflecting contempt specifically toward sex workers.
The frame normalizes minimizing serious harm against women by presenting their violence and death as comedic.
The frame treats her as easily replaceable or expendable, reducing her humanity and value to nothing.
The frame uses the term 'hooker' as an insult, reducing a woman's identity to a stigmatized profession, reflecting derogatory labeling.
The meme devalues the life of a sex worker by suggesting that murdering her is insignificant, demonstrating a blatant disrespect toward individuals in the sex industry.
The problem of disposability arises as the frame reduces a woman—specifically a sex worker—to an object that can be thrown away like trash.
The problem of disposability arises as the meme labels her worthless and disposable, portraying her as easily discarded once ‘used.’
The problem of disposability arises as the meme treats the woman as an expendable object, implying she can be discarded without consequence.
The problem of disrespect towards women arises as the frame advocates for violent and demeaning treatment of sex workers, denying them basic human dignity.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the frame dehumanizes sex workers by portraying them as worthless and expendable, undermining their dignity and worth.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the frame devalues women in sex work by labeling them as dirty and contaminated, undermining their dignity and personhood.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the frame uses the derogatory label “hooker” and mocks her humanity, devaluing her dignity and worth.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme demeans the woman based solely on her profession, stripping her of dignity.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme refers to a sex worker as a “slightly used hooker,” reducing her to an object and demeaning her humanity.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme uses the term 'dead hookers', demeaning and degrading women in sex work by stripping them of their humanity.

The problem of disrespecting sex workers is evoked because the frame targets a ‘hooker’ victim, mocking both her profession and the violent act, thus demeaning women in the sex industry and normalizing violence against them.
The problem of victim blaming arises as the frame attributes fault to sex workers themselves, suggesting they ‘deserve’ abuse for their profession.
The problem of violence arises as the meme normalizes harm or murder by depicting the act of digging a grave for a prostitute as acceptable.
This frame normalizes and glorifies physical harm toward women by presenting violence as acceptable and humorous.
This frame strips sex workers of human qualities by portraying them as deserving of violence, reducing them to less-than-human status.

level_1_values.rationale: The frame emphasizes asserting power and dominance over marginalized women, reflecting a value of enhancing one's own status at the expense of others.
The frame upholds strict moral codes by punishing perceived deviance (sex work), reflecting a desire to maintain social order and traditional norms.

level_2_values.rationale: The frame devalues and endorses violence against sex workers, reflecting a quest for dominance over a marginalized group.
The frame enforces moral rules by condemning sex work as improper and advocating punitive measures against those who violate these norms.

level_3_values.rationale: The frame implies that dominant groups can influence societal attitudes to justify violence against sex workers.
The frame suggests that certain individuals have the authority to order or enact punitive actions against sex workers.
By punishing those who deviate from moral norms, the frame underscores the importance of self-discipline to stay within acceptable behavior.
The derogation of sex workers as immoral enforces adherence to prescribed proper behavior.

level_1_values.rationale: The frame devalues sex workers by denying them autonomy and individuality, but Openness to Change emphasizes valuing personal freedom and self-direction, contradicting the notion that women are disposable.
The frame treats sex workers as less than human, whereas Self-Transcendence centers on caring for others, equality, and universal respect, opposing such dehumanization.

level_2_values.rationale: Supports freedom of thought and critical analysis, enabling individuals to question and resist demeaning narratives about sex workers.
Upholds the right of sex workers to make their own choices about their lives and bodies, directly opposing their portrayal as disposable.
Promotes compassion and support for sex workers, counteracting attitudes that devalue and demean individuals in the sex industry.
Advocates for equality and justice for all people, including marginalized groups like sex workers, thereby rejecting their disposability.
Encourages acceptance and understanding of people different from oneself, directly opposing the stigma and contempt directed at sex workers.

level_3_values.rationale: Sex workers deserve the intellectual freedom to make their own judgments and resist demeaning societal narratives.
Recognizes the autonomy and agency of sex workers to lead their own lives, opposing the idea they are expendable.
Affirms the right of sex workers to pursue personal goals and careers, contradicting the notion they exist solely for others' utility.
Supports the right of individuals to control their own bodies and actions, challenging the frame that views women as expendable.
Protects the personal boundaries and safety of sex workers, opposing their commodification and disposability.
Encourages empathy and respect for sex workers as human beings deserving of care and dignity.
Promotes support systems and assistance for sex workers rather than demeaning them.
Calls for equal rights and opportunities for sex workers, directly opposing their devaluation.
Demands fairness and legal protection for sex workers, countering injustices inherent in portraying them as disposable.
Encourages overcoming prejudices against sex work, challenging the narrow condemnation inherent in the frame.

level_3_values.level_3_value: Have the wisdom to accept others
level_3_values.rationale: Advocates for mature understanding and acceptance of sex workers, opposing stigmatizing and dismissive attitudes.

feedback: The selected Level 1 values (“Openness to Change” and “Self-Transcendence”) are the exact opposites of the ones expressed by the hateful frame. We should identify which values the content itself is promoting (e.g. contempt, dominance, exclusion), not which positive values it undermines.
At Level 1, the frame expresses Self-Enhancement (dominance) and Conservation (conformity/security). It is not about personal freedom or caring for others.
At Level 2, choose from the applicable values under those Level 1 domains: e.g. Power (dominance) under Self-Enhancement; Conformity (interpersonal) or Security (social order) under Conservation.
At Level 3, select the fine-grained indicators that match threats of violence and dehumanization: e.g. “Control over others,” “Threaten to eliminate,” “Maintain social norms by excluding deviants.”
Review each rationale: it should refer to how the text specifically enacts dominance or enforces conformity against sex workers, rather than praising autonomy or empathy.

level_1_values.rationale: The frame glorifies dominance by advocating violence and demeaning sex workers, expressing a desire to assert power over them and reduce them to disposable objects.
The frame enforces traditional moral norms by excluding and punishing sex workers as deviants, seeking to preserve social conformity and stability through their dehumanization.

level_2_values.rationale: The hateful content asserts dominance over sex workers, endorsing their subjugation and the use of physical harm to maintain hierarchical inequality.
By labeling sex workers as worthless and advocating their elimination, the frame demands adherence to strict behavioral norms and punishes those who deviate from accepted moral standards.

level_3_values.rationale: The frame seeks to dominate sex workers by undermining their agency and asserting control over their status and worth.
Endorsing violence against sex workers reflects a claim to authority and permission to dictate their fate without accountability.
The content implies that only those who conform to strict moral codes deserve recognition, punishing perceived deviants like sex workers for failing to control themselves.
By demeaning and threatening punishment against sex workers, the frame reinforces the expectation that individuals must adhere to established social and moral norms.

level_1_values.rationale: The frame glorifies dominance by advocating violence and demeaning sex workers, expressing a desire to assert power over them and reduce them to disposable objects.
The frame enforces traditional moral norms by excluding and punishing sex workers as deviants, seeking to preserve social conformity and stability through their dehumanization.

level_2_values.rationale: The hateful content asserts dominance over sex workers, endorsing their subjugation and the use of physical harm to maintain hierarchical inequality.
By labeling sex workers as worthless and advocating their elimination, the frame demands adherence to strict behavioral norms and punishes those who deviate from accepted moral standards.

level_3_values.rationale: The frame seeks to dominate sex workers by undermining their agency and asserting control over their status and worth.
Endorsing violence against sex workers reflects a claim to authority and permission to dictate their fate without accountability.
The content implies that only those who conform to strict moral codes deserve recognition, punishing perceived deviants like sex workers for failing to control themselves.
By demeaning and threatening punishment against sex workers, the frame reinforces the expectation that individuals must adhere to established social and moral norms.

feedback: Level 2: Replace “Conformity (interpersonal)” with “Conformity (rules)”. The frame’s rationale (“strict moral codes”, “punishes deviants”) aligns with rule‐based conformity rather than interpersonal politeness.

Level 3: After switching to Conformity (rules), retain “Be self-disciplined” and “Be behaving properly” as they map correctly under rule‐based conformity. Discard these under interpersonal conformity.
Level 3 for Power (dominance) is correctly mapped to “Have influence” and “Have the right to command.”

level_1_values.rationale: The frame emphasizes asserting power and dominance over marginalized women, reflecting a value of enhancing one's own status at the expense of others.
The frame upholds strict moral codes by punishing perceived deviance (sex work), reflecting a desire to maintain social order and traditional norms.

level_2_values.rationale: The frame devalues and endorses violence against sex workers, reflecting a quest for dominance over a marginalized group.
The frame enforces moral rules by condemning sex work as improper and advocating punitive measures against those who violate these norms.

level_3_values.rationale: The frame implies that dominant groups can influence societal attitudes to justify violence against sex workers.
The frame suggests that certain individuals have the authority to order or enact punitive actions against sex workers.
By punishing those who deviate from moral norms, the frame underscores the importance of self-discipline to stay within acceptable behavior.
The derogation of sex workers as immoral enforces adherence to prescribed proper behavior.

frame.frame: Women should be reduced to derogatory labels and sexual objects.
rationale: By equating them with expendable objects through derogatory labels, the frame reduces these women to disposable entities.
By singling out sex workers and reducing their status to a slur once dead, it disrespects and devalues sex workers’ identities.
The frame encourages the use of contemptuous language toward women in sex work, directly invoking disrespect and demeaning their humanity.
The frame explicitly prescribes using negative, contemptuous labels for women based on their profession, invoking derogatory labeling.
The problem of demonization arises as the meme portrays women as immoral or perverse beings, dehumanizing them.
The problem of derogatory labeling arises as the frame endorses using negative, demeaning language and public humiliation to criticize women for their sexual choices.
The problem of derogatory labeling arises as the frame explicitly endorses calling sex workers derogatory names like 'bitch' and 'hoe', reinforcing negative stereotypes.
The problem of derogatory labeling arises as the meme uses demeaning wordplay ('fucklings', 'hoebbits') to label women with contemptuous terms.
The problem of derogatory labeling arises as the meme uses the term “prostitute” in a contemptuous way to demean the woman.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the frame asserts that sex workers merit contempt and insults, undermining their humanity and profession.

The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the frame perpetuates the notion that women who express or are assumed to have sexual agency deserve contempt, further stigmatizing and demeaning sex workers.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the frame uses derogatory labels towards sex workers, demeaning them and denying them basic respect and dignity.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme mocks and trivializes women in the sex industry, reducing their profession to a punchline.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme reduces her identity to a negative stereotype, implying she is unworthy of respect.
The problem of objectification arises as the text reduces women to mere sexual objects for amusement, overlooking their individuality and worth.

level_1_values.rationale: The misogynistic frame degrades and dehumanizes women, conflicting with self-transcendence values that emphasize concern for the welfare of all individuals and the rejection of discrimination.

level_2_values.rationale: This value promotes equality and protection of the vulnerable, directly challenging the demeaning and discriminatory treatment of women and sex workers.
Encouraging open-mindedness and acceptance of those who are different opposes the stigmatization and dehumanization inherent in reducing women to objects.
Focusing on empathy, compassion, and caring for others contradicts attitudes that demean or exploit women, especially those in marginalized professions like sex work.

level_3_values.rationale: Upholding equal rights and opportunities for all genders undermines any attempt to reduce women to mere objects or derogatory labels.
Ensuring fairness and impartial treatment for everyone rejects the unfair devaluation and mistreatment of women.
Being open to different lifestyles and perspectives opposes prejudices that stereotype and demean women based on their profession or appearance.

level_3_values.level_3_value: Have the wisdom to accept others
level_3_values.rationale: Accepting individuals regardless of their life choices or work challenges the stigmatization of sex workers and prevents dehumanizing labels.
Promoting empathy and compassion counters the exploitation and objectification of women by fostering respectful and caring relationships.

frame.frame: Women who dress in a certain way are prostitutes.
rationale: It also promotes transactional relationships by reducing interpersonal relationships to purely financial exchanges.
The frame devalues women by labeling them as ‘prostitutes’ and treating that status as justification for contempt, directly disrespecting sex workers.
The problem of derogatory labeling arises as the meme uses the term 'hooker' in a contemptuous way to suggest dishonesty about appearance.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as it mocks her use of padding and push-up bras, demeaning her as a sex worker and implying deceit is inherent to her profession.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the frame denigrates and devalues actual sex workers by using the term “prostitute” as an insult based solely on appearance.

The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the frame equates all women to sex workers in a derogatory way, demeaning both women and those in the sex industry by suggesting manipulation and dishonesty are inherent to their interactions.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme treats a woman’s body as merchandise, undermining her autonomy and dignity.

The problem of disrespecting sex workers is evoked because the frame equates mothers with prostitutes, mocking and demeaning individuals in the sex industry by treating their work as shameful and unworthy of respect.
The problem of reductionism arises as the frame oversimplifies and distorts women’s identities by equating their choice of clothing with the narrow stereotype of being a prostitute.

The problem of transactional relationships arises as the frame reduces romantic and social interactions with women to purely financial exchanges, implying that women engage with men solely for monetary benefit.
The problem of transactional relationships arises as the meme reduces interactions with women to purely economic exchanges, equating a woman to a commodity for sale.
This frame disrespects sex workers by equating women to prostitutes, demeaning both groups by implying their worth is tied solely to money.

level_1_values.rationale: The misogynistic frame condemns women’s dress based on tradition, restricting personal autonomy, creativity, and freedom of self-expression, which directly opposes the value of openness to change.
The frame devalues women and sex workers by stigmatizing their choices, undermining the universalist and benevolent principles of caring, equality, and respect for all individuals.

level_2_values.rationale: Judging women’s attire as prostitution denies their freedom of thought and expression, opposing the idea that individuals should form their own ideas and beliefs without external moral policing.
Labeling women based on clothing restricts their freedom to make personal choices about how they present themselves, undermining their autonomy.
The frame’s narrow stereotyping of women violates the principle of accepting and understanding those who are different, fostering intolerance rather than inclusion.
By stigmatizing women’s dress and sex work, the frame fails to promote fairness, equality, and protection for a marginalized group, opposing the universalist goal of justice and concern for all.

level_3_values.rationale: Encourages allowing women to think and express themselves freely without fear of being labeled or shamed for their appearance.
Supports women’s right to make personal choices about attire, contradicting the imposition of moral judgments on their behavior.
Upholds women’s independence in deciding how to dress without social condemnation or external control.
Counters narrow stereotypes by promoting acceptance of diverse expressions of identity and lifestyle choices.
Rejects unequal treatment based on appearance, affirming that all individuals deserve equal respect and rights regardless of how they dress.
Demands fair and unbiased treatment, resisting prejudicial labeling of women as sex workers solely on the basis of their clothing.

rationale: The problem of dehumanization arises as the meme portrays strippers as lacking authentic human feelings, reducing them to objects driven solely by drug intoxication.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme generalizes that all strippers are drug users, undermining their dignity and work.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme implies that strippers’ emotions are not genuine, demeaning their humanity and agency.
The problem of stereotyping arises as the meme perpetuates a false and broad generalization about sex workers, reinforcing negative assumptions about their behavior.

level_1_values.rationale: The frame relies on rigid stereotypes and discourages independent, novel thinking, contradicting the value of openness and freedom to form one own ideas about individuals.
This frame devalues a marginalized group and rejects concern for all individuals, whereas self-transcendence emphasizes equality, justice, and empathy for everyone.

level_2_values.rationale: By imposing a false generalization about strippers, the frame restricts individuals' freedom to think and be recognized as unique.
The stereotype denies personal autonomy and agency of sex workers; valuing self-direction supports individuals making their own life choices.
The frame promotes intolerance and prejudice toward a group; this value champions acceptance and understanding of diverse occupations and identities.
The frame unfairly devalues strippers, whereas universal concern seeks equality and fairness for all people regardless of profession.
The claim is a biased, unverified generalization; valuing objectivity encourages evidence-based, unbiased assessments of individuals.

level_3_values.rationale: Encourages questioning stereotypes rather than accepting a blanket claim about all strippers using drugs.
Opposes the sweeping generalization by upholding each persons right to an independent identity and beliefs.
Recognizes the autonomy of sex workers and rejects the notion that they conform to a single harmful behavior.
Supports individuals right to make personal choices without being stigmatized by stereotypes.
Requires openness to diversity, directly countering the closed-minded prejudice against strippers.

level_3_values.level_3_value: Have the wisdom to accept others
level_3_values.rationale: Promotes mature acceptance of individuals regardless of occupation, undermining dismissive generalizations.
Directly opposes the devaluation of strippers by affirming that all people deserve equal respect and opportunities.
Demands fair treatment and guards against baseless generalizations that harm a group.
Encourages reliance on reason and evidence, which refutes the hasty, unsupported claim.
Promotes balanced evaluation of individuals rather than stereotyping an entire profession.

frame.frame: Extreme sexual acts involving women are meant to be a source of humor.
rationale: The problem of violence arises as the meme depicts and trivializes extreme sexual acts that can be harmful and degrading to women, normalizing violent or abusive behavior.

The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme mocks and degrades women in sex work by portraying their ‘shift’ as vomiting or covered in bodily fluids, demeaning their dignity and reinforcing contempt toward women in the sex industry.

level_1_values.rationale: This frame stifles women’s autonomy and creative expression, undermining values that support freedom of thought and action.
By demeaning and dehumanizing women, the frame contradicts values of empathy, compassion, and universal respect for all people.

level_2_values.rationale: This frame denies women intellectual autonomy by reducing their sexuality to comedic spectacle, opposing the value of independent thought.
By mocking extreme sexual acts as humor, it undermines women's agency in making decisions about their own bodies, contradicting the value of self-determined action.
The frame devalues and humiliates women, contradicting the universalist ideal of equal concern and protection for all individuals.
It rejects and ridicules women's sexual autonomy, opposing the value of accepting and understanding differences.
The frame relies on biased stereotypes rather than objective understanding of women’s experiences, opposing rational, impartial evaluation.
The frame is demeaning and lacks compassion for women, contradicting the value of caring and support for others.

level_3_values.rationale: This frame mocks women as objects of humor, denying their freedom to express and explore ideas about sexuality without stigma, thus contradicting the value of autonomy in thought.
Instead of genuinely understanding women's sexual experiences, the frame uses them as comedic props, opposing the exploration and respectful inquiry that curiosity entails.
The frame treats women as dependent comedic devices rather than autonomous agents making their own choices, conflicting with supporting independence.
By ridiculing women's sexual conduct, this frame restricts their legitimacy to act freely, opposing the value of autonomy in action.
Mocking women for sexual behavior undermines equal respect for all genders, violating the principle of equality.
The frame perpetuates unfair, discriminatory humor against women, contradicting justice and fairness.
Rather than tolerating and respecting diverse forms of sexual expression, the frame dismisses them as jokes, opposing broadminded acceptance.

level_3_values.level_3_value: Have the wisdom to accept others
level_3_values.rationale: This frame deems certain sexual expressions laughable instead of accepting differences, violating the wisdom to respect others' choices.
It misrepresents women and sex workers for comedic effect, violating the value of truthful and respectful portrayal.
Using women's bodies as jokes denies compassion and care for their dignity, opposing the value of love and empathy.

frame.frame: Women's worth is meant to be tied to their physical attributes.
rationale: The problem of objectification arises as the meme mocks a woman labeled as a 'busty hooker' for using padding and push-up bras, reducing her to her physical appearance and suggesting her value is solely based on her looks.
The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the portrayal demeans her profession by implying that her worth is defined entirely by her physical attributes.

level_1_values.rationale: This value opposes rigid gender norms and supports individuals defining their own worth beyond societal expectations tied to appearance.
Emphasizes concern for others and equality, challenging the objectification that devalues women based on looks.

level_2_values.rationale: Encourages critical reflection and autonomy in beliefs, countering socially imposed standards that tie worth to appearance.
Supports individuals’ right to choose goals and paths free from superficial judgments, undermining objectification.
Promotes equality and justice for all, rejecting discriminatory valuation based on physical attributes.
Fosters acceptance of diverse bodies and identities, opposing narrow beauty standards.
Advocates unbiased evaluation of individuals by character and abilities rather than appearance.

level_3_values.rationale: Encourages questioning and rejecting sexist norms that define women’s worth by looks.
Affirms individuals’ autonomy to set personal aspirations independent of appearance-based validation.
Highlights self-sufficiency and autonomy, counteracting dependence on external approval of appearance.
Ensures all people are valued equally, contradicting worth tied solely to physical attributes.
Supports fair treatment and opposes discriminatory valuation of women based on looks.
Encourages openness to varied standards of beauty and worth, challenging narrow objectification.
Promotes impartial appraisal of individuals’ qualities beyond appearance, countering superficial judgments.

frame.frame: Religious people are hypocritical for condemning the murder of a prostitute while worshipping a deity who committed mass murder.
rationale: By highlighting religious condemnation of killing a prostitute as hypocritical, the meme continues to demean and devalue the sex worker’s life, reinforcing disrespect toward sex workers.

level_1_values.rationale: The frame appeals to universal moral standards, emphasizing equal moral worth and critiquing hypocrisy across different groups.
The frame challenges traditional beliefs and encourages reevaluating established religious norms.

level_2_values.rationale: The frame calls for an objective application of moral principles, questioning biased condemnations.
The frame promotes broadminded acceptance of all individuals’ moral worth, regardless of their background.
The frame encourages acting on one’s own judgment and freedom to question prevailing norms.

level_3_values.rationale: Reflects the Universalism (objectivity) value by advocating impartial moral evaluation.
Reflects the Universalism (tolerance) value by encouraging acceptance of diverse moral perspectives.
Reflects the Self-direction (action) value by supporting individuals’ autonomy to challenge norms.

level_1_values.rationale: This value emphasizes caring for all individuals and promoting equality, directly opposing the demeaning of sex workers.
This value supports autonomy and acceptance of diverse life choices, challenging restrictive judgments against sex workers.

level_2_values.rationale: Promotes equal treatment and protection of vulnerable groups like sex workers, countering narratives that devalue them.
Encourages acceptance of people regardless of their profession or lifestyle, undermining stigma against sex workers.
Fosters compassion and support for sex workers, opposing devaluation and condemnation.
Affirms the right of sex workers to make their own life choices and control their work, rejecting paternalistic interference.

level_3_values.rationale: Argues for equal respect and opportunities for sex workers, opposing their devaluation in discourse.
Advocates openness to different professions and lifestyles, reducing prejudice against sex workers.

level_3_values.level_3_value: Have the wisdom to accept others
level_3_values.rationale: Encourages understanding and acceptance of sex workers' circumstances and choices.
Promotes empathy and care towards sex workers instead of condemnation.
Supports providing assistance and resources to sex workers rather than judgment or demeaning them.
Values the autonomy of sex workers to choose their work and lives without stigma or coercion.
Protects the personal boundaries and safety of sex workers, opposing intrusion and public shaming.

feedback: Remove 'Be helpful' as the meme does not advocate providing assistance to sex workers.
Remove 'Have privacy' since the frame focuses on religious hypocrisy, not on protecting sex workers' privacy.
Remove 'Be loving' because the meme does not explicitly promote an affectionate stance toward sex workers.
Add 'Be just' at Level 3 to capture the frame’s emphasis on fairness and highlighting hypocrisy.
Consider adding 'Universalism (objectivity)' at Level 2 to reflect the argument about objective moral standards versus hypocritical behavior.
Revise the rationales to center on the condemnation of hypocrisy and the recognition of equal moral worth for the prostitute, rather than implying active support or assistance.
Ensure each rationale directly ties back to specific language or argument in the frame, e.g., emphasizing the call for consistent moral judgment rather than broad compassion or privacy protections.

level_1_values.rationale: The frame condemns moral inconsistency by highlighting that a prostitute’s life deserves the same ethical consideration as any other, reflecting concern for equal moral worth beyond personal or group interests.
By challenging traditional religious norms and calling out hypocrisy in moral judgments, the frame encourages critical reassessment of established beliefs and openness to evolving ethical standards.

level_2_values.rationale: The frame appeals to consistent moral principles by contrasting religious condemnation of a prostitute’s murder with devotion to a mass-murdering deity, underscoring the need for objective and impartial ethical standards.

By asserting that a prostitute should receive the same moral protection as other individuals, the frame advocates accepting all people as equally deserving of moral consideration despite societal biases.
The meme encourages individuals to independently question and challenge religious doctrines that employ double standards, promoting autonomous moral reasoning and critique of hypocrisy.

level_3_values.rationale: The frame explicitly asserts that a prostitute’s life merits the same moral value and condemnation of violence as any other, demanding equal treatment in ethical judgments.
By exposing the inconsistency of condemning a prostitute’s killing while venerating a mass-murdering deity, the meme calls for a wider, more inclusive perspective on who deserves moral consideration.

level_3_values.level_3_value: Have the wisdom to accept others
level_3_values.rationale: The message invites recognition of the prostitute’s moral worth and urges abandonment of biased judgments, reflecting the insight to treat all individuals fairly.
The frame emphasizes fair and impartial moral judgment, highlighting hypocrisy in applying different standards to different victims and calling for consistency in ethical evaluation.

level_1_values.rationale: The frame condemns moral inconsistency by highlighting that a prostitute’s life deserves the same ethical consideration as any other, reflecting concern for equal moral worth beyond personal or group interests.
By challenging traditional religious norms and calling out hypocrisy in moral judgments, the frame encourages critical reassessment of established beliefs and openness to evolving ethical standards.

level_2_values.rationale: The frame appeals to consistent moral principles by contrasting religious condemnation of a prostitute’s murder with devotion to a mass-murdering deity, underscoring the need for objective and impartial ethical standards.

By asserting that a prostitute should receive the same moral protection as other individuals, the frame advocates accepting all people as equally deserving of moral consideration despite societal biases.
The meme encourages individuals to independently question and challenge religious doctrines that employ double standards, promoting autonomous moral reasoning and critique of hypocrisy.

level_3_values.rationale: The frame explicitly asserts that a prostitute’s life merits the same moral value and condemnation of violence as any other, demanding equal treatment in ethical judgments.
By exposing the inconsistency of condemning a prostitute’s killing while venerating a mass-murdering deity, the meme calls for a wider, more inclusive perspective on who deserves moral consideration.

level_3_values.level_3_value: Have the wisdom to accept others
level_3_values.rationale: The message invites recognition of the prostitute’s moral worth and urges abandonment of biased judgments, reflecting the insight to treat all individuals fairly.
The frame emphasizes fair and impartial moral judgment, highlighting hypocrisy in applying different standards to different victims and calling for consistency in ethical evaluation.

feedback: Level 1 and Level 2 values align well with the frame’s emphasis on universal moral standards and the challenge to traditional beliefs.

The rationale mischaracterizes the frame as demeaning the prostitute, when in fact it advocates equal moral worth; revise it to reflect the frame’s universalist critique rather than portraying it as disparagement.

At Level 3, the values “Have equality” and “Be just” are not in the provided applicable list. Remove them and instead use “Have an objective view” (for Universalism–objectivity) and “Be logical” (for Universalism–tolerance or impartiality).

Map each Level 3 value clearly back to its parent Level 2 category: for Universalism (objectivity) use “Have an objective view,” for Universalism (tolerance) use “Be broadminded,” and for Self-direction (action) use “Have freedom of action.”

level_1_values.rationale: The frame appeals to universal moral standards, emphasizing equal moral worth and critiquing hypocrisy across different groups.
The frame challenges traditional beliefs and encourages reevaluating established religious norms.

level_2_values.rationale: The frame calls for an objective application of moral principles, questioning biased condemnations.
The frame promotes broadminded acceptance of all individuals’ moral worth, regardless of their background.
The frame encourages acting on one’s own judgment and freedom to question prevailing norms.

level_3_values.rationale: Reflects the Universalism (objectivity) value by advocating impartial moral evaluation.
Reflects the Universalism (tolerance) value by encouraging acceptance of diverse moral perspectives.
Reflects the Self-direction (action) value by supporting individuals’ autonomy to challenge norms.

frame.frame: The only way a woman can survive an economic collapse is by selling her body.
rationale: The problem of disrespecting sex workers arises as the meme equates all women to sexual commodities, demeaning those in sex work by suggesting it’s their sole means of survival.
The problem of transactional relationships arises as the meme reduces women’s survival strategies to purely financial and sexual exchanges, framing relationships and value solely in economic terms.

level_1_values.rationale: This value emphasizes women's capacity to explore new solutions and adapt, countering the frame's implication that they have no viable options other than selling their bodies.
This value highlights caring for and respecting all individuals, promoting dignity and equality for women rather than reducing them to economic or sexual commodities.

level_2_values.rationale: The frame suggests women lack agency and only have a single option; this value underscores women's right to choose diverse survival strategies and take purposeful action.
The frame presumes women's thinking is limited to transactional sex; this value affirms their freedom to form independent thoughts and set their own goals.
The frame devalues empathy for women in crisis; this value stresses caring about their well-being and recognizing their humanity beyond economic terms.
The frame stigmatizes women and sex work; this value supports accepting diverse backgrounds and survival choices without judgment.
The frame rests on biased, illogical assumptions; this value calls for an objective, fact-based view of women's roles and the complexity of economic survival.
The frame ignores compassion; this value highlights the importance of supporting and caring for women facing hardship.

level_3_values.rationale: Counters the portrayal of women as dependent by affirming their ability to rely on themselves and make their own way.
Opposes the notion that women have no choices by endorsing their right to act freely in economic and personal decisions.
Affirms women's right to set and pursue diverse aims rather than being confined to a single, demeaning narrative.
Supports the idea that women can and should think critically and independently, resisting reductive stereotypes.
Encourages an objective, fact-based perspective that rejects the frame's unfounded assumptions about women's survival strategies.
Promotes active support and assistance for women in crisis rather than demeaning them.
Emphasizes compassion and care for women facing economic hardship.
Affirms that women deserve the same respect and opportunities as men, opposing the frame's demeaning stance.
Calls for fairness in how we view and treat women, countering the unjust reduction of their worth to sexual transactions.
Encourages openness to different life paths and economic strategies, challenging the frame's narrow and stigmatizing view.

level_3_values.level_3_value: Have the wisdom to accept others
level_3_values.rationale: Highlights the importance of understanding and accepting diverse experiences and choices without prejudice.

level_1_values.rationale: The frame restricts women to a single, demeaning survival strategy, ignoring their capacity for self-determination and innovation. Openness to Change values highlight the importance of women having other creative and autonomous paths

The frame devalues women and sex workers, pitting personal gain over collective welfare. Self-Transcendence values emphasize care, justice, and equality, directly opposing the demeaning and exclusionary nature of the frame

level_2_values.rationale: The frame denies women the ability to choose alternative actions and strategies, forcing them into one restrictive role. Self-direction (action) emphasizes women’s right to plan and decide their own lives

By presenting a single survival option, the frame stifles critical thinking and women’s freedom to envision diverse solutions. Self-direction (thought) champions freedom of thought and individual ideas
The frame ignores social justice and fairness for women, especially those in sex work. Universalism (concern) promotes equality and justice for all, countering the devaluation of marginalized workers

By dismissing other survival methods and stigmatizing sex work, the frame lacks acceptance of diverse life choices. Universalism (tolerance) encourages broadmindedness and acceptance of different occupations and circumstances

The frame shows no compassion or support for women facing hardship and reduces them to a commodity. Benevolence (caring) underscores the importance of compassion and supportive actions for those in need

level_3_values.rationale: Contradicts the frame by affirming women’s right to self-reliance and diverse survival strategies beyond selling their bodies
Opposes the idea that women are forced into a single role, highlighting their right to choose varied paths in crisis
Challenges the frame’s imposition of a single strategy by encouraging women to set and pursue their own life objectives
Refutes the frame’s narrow perspective by valuing critical thinking and the exploration of multiple survival options
Counters the frame’s lack of communal support by emphasizing the societal duty to assist women in economic hardship through varied means
Contradicts the demeaning tone by advocating compassion and respect for women’s dignity, including sex workers
Directly opposes the devaluation of women, asserting equal rights and opportunities to survive an economic crisis without stigma
Rejects the unfair singling out of sex work as a sole option, promoting fair treatment and nondiscrimination for all professions
Opposes the stigmatizing frame by encouraging acceptance of diverse survival strategies and occupational choices

level_3_values.level_3_value: Have the wisdom to accept others
level_3_values.rationale: Counters the dismissive attitude by advocating understanding and respect for women’s different circumstances and decisions
Challenges the frame’s portrayal of helplessness by recognizing women’s bravery in seeking alternative, dignified ways to survive

feedback: Remove 'Be courageous' from Level 3 values as it is not an applicable taxonomy value.
Update 'Be choosing own goals' to 'Be choosing your own goals' to match the exact wording in the taxonomy.
Ensure the applicable Level 2 list is correctly parsed so that 'Universalism (tolerance)' and 'Universalism (objectivity)' are treated as separate values rather than concatenated.

level_1_values.rationale: The meme denies women the opportunity to adapt and find creative alternatives during economic hardship, instead prescribing a single survival strategy.
By portraying women solely as sexual commodities, the frame undermines concern for women’s welfare and broader compassionate values.

level_2_values.rationale: The frame restricts women’s ability to choose diverse actions for survival, reducing their agency to only one predictable path.
By insisting the sole solution is selling one’s body, the meme denies women the freedom to think of or pursue alternative strategies.
The depiction ignores women’s broader needs and fails to show genuine concern for their varied wellbeing.
It shows intolerance for different survival choices by insisting only one path is viable.
The frame reflects a biased, one-dimensional view of women’s capabilities, lacking an objective perspective on their options.
By reducing women to mere economic or sexual tools, the meme lacks empathy and caring toward their real-life struggles.

level_3_values.rationale: This frame undermines the idea that women can independently navigate crises through various means other than sex work.
It denies women the freedom to pursue different survival strategies by claiming a single option.
The meme strips women of the right to set and follow their own diverse life goals beyond economic transactions.
Suggesting only one survival method denies women the intellectual freedom to consider multiple solutions.
The narrative is not helpful, as it dismisses social support and alternative assistance systems for women.
By demeaning women’s choices, the frame lacks compassion and understanding for their circumstances.
It treats women unequally by implying they lack access to the same survival options as others.
The assertion is unjust because it unfairly narrows women’s survival paths to a stigmatized activity.
The meme’s narrow viewpoint contradicts a broadminded acceptance of diverse coping strategies.

level_3_values.level_3_value: Have the wisdom to accept others
level_3_values.rationale: It shows a lack of wisdom by failing to recognize and accept varied legitimate ways women might endure hardship.
